review.reviewBody: This pack is durable, light, and loaded with tons of features. I purchased this pack because I love my Mystery Ranch fire pack. So far this one lives up to the quality Mystery Ranch reputation.
review.name: Lives up to the quality Mystery Ranch reputation

review.reviewBody: very comfortable on trail packs. adaptable layout.
review.name: great layout!

review.reviewBody: Pretty innovative new design of shoulder straps for carrying heavy weight. Super comfortable even loaded up. Great design with lots of pockets and places to store items. Really very happy with this purchase! Backcountry is a great company. Second time purchasing from them. Quick and responsive
review.name: Excellent backpack

review.reviewBody:
I've owned the Bridger 65 for just over a year and have taken it on many multi-day trips, so I wanted to provide some feedback based on my experience. While this pack has several great features, unfortunately, they don't function as well as I had hoped.
  The main issue I’ve encountered is with the Yoke/Water Bottle chest strap/shoulder strap design. In theory, the water bottle pockets are a fantastic idea, but in practice, it's nearly impossible to fit a water bottle into them if the pack is strapped down tightly. This design flaw also contributes to the overall discomfort of the shoulder straps.  I’ve attempted to adjust the pack so that it is comfortable, however I’ve not been able to make this pack fit comfortably.
  If you have any chest or pectoral development, this pack becomes especially uncomfortable. The padding in the shoulder straps doesn't extend far enough into the chest region, and as a result, the thin material in the chest pockets digs into your armpit area. A potential solution to this issue would be offering different shoulder strap options to accommodate various body types.
  Regrettably, I will be transitioning to a new pack. It's disappointing, as I had high hopes for what seemed like a great design feature, but ultimately, this pack didn’t meet my expectations. It ended up being an expensive test for a design that didn't work out for me.
review.name: Shoulder Strap Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I want to start by saying I have the coulee pack and give it 5 stars, love that thing. But the Bridget is different. I felt it was comfortable with no weight, but once weight was applied it was a different story. Had close to 40 lbs. on a trip to Buffalo River, and can say that I hurt. I am athletic build with what is called a bubble butt. The frame drops below the hip pad, and finds a nice spot to dig on the upper part of my butt.  If have to step up on something the still planted leg gets it even worse. By the end of 8.5 miles I couldn’t think of anything I’d rather not do, than to put on the pack. I emailed Mystery Ranch and they thought it wasn’t adjusted right. I’ve backpacked most of my life and know well how to adjust packs, but I did what they said. I walked around with 30 lbs in my house for an hour and my butt wasn’t happy. So the back pad of the belt is at my lower back and the two points of the frame on the top part of my butt.  So I would recommend for most people that like organization and don’t mind the weight. Wouldn’t recommend for people built like me or want a more streamline lighter weight pack.
review.name: Good for most

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack to replace my Glacier 70L for a backpacking trip in the Tetons. This pack so super comfortable. I had no issues with any pinching at the waist and loads of comfort at my shoulders. The pack was loaded with features and pockets for gear. We did a 3 day 2 night trip through the Tetons and had no issues. My buddy wore the pack and was blown away at how comfortable the pack was loaded down. I highly recommend this pack for anyone that just wants a “one and done” pack. Mystery ranch nails it again!!
review.name: Best pack ever!!!

review.reviewBody: I BOUGHT THIS BAG FOR SOME UPCOMING LONG WEEKEND BACKPACKING TRIPS.  I NOTED A FAVORABLE REVIEW ONLINE AND BEGAN DRILLING INTO THE COMPANY AND THE PRODUCT.  WHAT CAUGHT MY ATTENTION WAS IT NOT BEING A SUPER LITE PACK, BUT A PACK THAT WOULD RIDE WELL, AND SUPPORT THE WEIGHT EVENLY.  IN ADDITION, IT HAD FEATURES ON IT THAT OTHERS DID NOT - HAVING THE FRONT SIDE WATER POCKETS IS A GAME CHANGER.  HAVING THE ABILITY TO USE THE TOP HALF AS A FANNY PACK I ALSO FOUND TO BE A GREAT SOLUTION TO GIVE EASIER ACCESS TO NEEDED THINGS ON TRAIL.  SO, IT WAS OBVIOUS THAT MYSTERY RANCH PUT A LOT OF THOUGHT INTO THESE PACKS AND HOW IT WOULD WORK ON THE TRAIL.  I AM 2 WEEKS OUT FROM MY TRIP AND LOOK FORWARD TO TESTING IT ON TRAIL. BUT I CAN SEE IN COMPARISON TO OTHER PACKS I OWN AND TESTING IT OUT THAT I AM GOING TO HAVE A POSITIVE EXPERIENCE.
review.name: BRIDGER 65

review.reviewBody: Probably one of the best packs I’ve used in recent future. Love that the main pack can be accessed from the top or the side. Harness is one of the best I’ve ever had, comfortable and sturdy. It doesn’t dig into your hips at all and has extra storage for small things and snacks. Probably should have bought this pack a long time ago. Really can’t go wrong, no complaints overall. Would buy again!
review.name: Fantastic Option!

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the Bridger but returned it because the bag capacity was too small for me.  I was lucky enough to have an extra large Glacier delivered as a replacement.  If you are looking for a Glacier or Terraplane backpack, you may find them very difficult to source.  Dana Design packs were once the top pack to have and I didn’t know that Mystery Ranch still 
made them.  However, supply chain issues and a major redesign plan mean both are extremely hard to source.  I now have my Glacier and it’s ready to go.  Beautiful pack.`I know it’s going to be great because I had a Dana Design Terraplane for years - best pack ever - and this new Glacier is the same, just a little smaller capacity.  Now that I’m 75, I’m ready to carry a bit less.
review.name: Bridger morphs into Glacier

review.reviewBody: I have a few different packs ranging from a frameless Deuter 45 liter to an older Arc’Teryx Bora 95, with a Dana Design Big Sky for day use.  I did quite a bit of looking at lighter packs to keep up with youngest kid but really glad I didn’t let the weight bother me and went with the Bridger. Picking it up it feels heavy but it feels lightless when adjusted properly and sitting on my hips.  If I feel like I need to save weight later, I’ll count grams on my sleep system and tent before I pick a different pack.
review.name: Serious upgrade

name: Bridger 65L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Ava Alpine II Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket looks and fits as promised! Very warm, and we didn’t notice the small hand inserts before purchasing, so that was a delightful surprise. The wearer is from Bogota and not accustomed to temperatures below 0°, and she loves it.
review.name: So warm! So comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Ava Alpine II Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cute and comfortable, but not very insulated. Doesn’t keep me that warm in the cold, midwest winds or snow and it’s not fitted at all. It’s very long feels oversized almost besides the ends of the sleeves. I hate the Velcro it’s hidden in the picture of course I wouldn’t have bought this. Had I known there was Velcro on it do not dry it with anything else or it will get covered in lint.
review.name: Just OK, get a different coat for the price

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 4th pair of Targhee II hikers and the fit is even better than previous pairs. I have a longer toe on my left foot that always bumps into the front of any shoe I wear, but not this pair. I wear an 8. 5 and this is true to size with plenty of room for a slightly thicker winter sock. The sole feels more supportive when I walk too. I always wear down the heel cushioning of my hikers so I'll be interested to see if this pair holds up better than the last few.
review.name: Even better fit than before

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Right out of the box the Targhee II was comfortable, wore them for several hours and had no pain anywhere! I have a lot of osteoarthritis and halix rigiditus in my big toes so finding shoes that are comfortable is extremely difficult but these are awesome!!!
review.name: Love my Targhee II

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wore today for the first time and feet were completely comfortable .
review.name: Comfortable boot for hiking

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love them. They are great for my my feet. I'm on my feet 9 hrs a day. I would buy them again.
review.name: Love

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have bought keen boots for years, but this pair came with a defect in the right toe box. I’m very disappointed.
review.name: I have bought keen boots

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the shoe but can’t get one to fir because they don’t make a women’s wide. Will have to buy a men’s version.
review.name: Not available on wide sizes

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I previously had the Targhee III boots that unfortunately didn't hold up well for me. Keen was super helpful in refunding them for me and I purchased style as a replacement. These boots seem like they will hold up very well. The waterproofing is very good, I've gone on hikes through tall grass with very heavy dew and came back with dry feet. They only lost one star because the Targhee III fit me better and was more comfortable. I feel like these boots just don't have as much room in the toes. These are the same size as my Targhee III 's but I would have gone half a size bigger with the Targhee II 's
review.name: Good boots

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've owned these boots for eight years and have put some punishing miles on them. Considering the all-day downpours, snow, and muddy, soggy trails I've hiked in, I am amazed that I have never once gotten wet feet. These boots have worn well since day one. The only discomfort I've ever experienced was due to a poor choice of socks, which were too loose. Recently, a half-inch chunk of the sole traction got torn off after I scraped around on some rough rocks. The boots definitely show their use with scratches on the rubber and leather, but they are still functional and waterproof. I can't stress enough how much I appreciate gear that can be used well and hard and still hold up for so long. I will be replacing them soon because of the sole damage, which I attribute to my being rough rather than any fault of the boot. Although I would not hesitate to buy this boot again, I am considering Kenetrek or Lowa boots too as I have heard excellent reviews of both. In reality, I just like switching things up. If you are looking for a light, waterproof, all-round hiking boot, the Targhee II's performance and price is unbeatable.
review.name: Impressive durability and comfort

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Keen Targhee II are the BEST boot for my foot. The wide toe box is superior, and I have hard feet to fil. I have had two pairs of these boots, they've taken me to the top of Mt Whitney and to the bottom of the Grand Canyon and beyond!! I'll never own a different hiking boot!! Love, love these boots cuz they take me, in comfort, where I must go!!!
review.name: Sheer Excellence

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the women's Targhee II boots before a trip to Iceland when I realized my old boots were too worn down to suffice. I didn't do much research but had several pairs of Keens in different forms and didn't have much time so just took the plunge, bought the Keens and packed them. And everything about them was amazing!

They were comfortable from the first time I wore them - no more having to wear them in over multiple hikes. They actually kept my feet warm in freezing weather, including traipsing through glacial puddles. They had amazing traction even on slippery rocks. And I felt secure with a footbox that gave my big toe room without feeling like I had too much space in front of the shoe. 

My husband also bought a pair of Keens for the trip and we would regularly remark out of the blue about how much we loved these boots (this is not something either of us ever do, it became kind of a joke). 

Of course everyone's feet are different, but for me I finally found the perfect boot. I couldn't recommend highly enough!
review.name: I love these boots!!!

name: Targhee II Mid Hiking Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Danner Trail 2650 Campo 3in Hiking Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trail 2650 Campo 3in Hiking Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Danner Trail 2650 Campo 3in Hiking Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my all time favorite hiking shoe  - especially for warm and dry days in the east. They keep my feet cool - but still very supportive. I love the grippy sole and I've felt very secure scrambling over rocks with them. Personally, I love the fixed tongue and the way it wraps around. They are difficult to slip on at first, but they loosen up once you start wearing them. Once that part is broken in, it's no problem. I have tried the 2650 with the normal tongue and I didd not like them as much as this one.  I've had these shoes for more than 2 years now on lots and lots of hikes and they have held up. They have started to wear at the mesh part a bit, near the toes, but no holes, despite visible wear.
review.name: Favorite for summer hike

review.reviewBody:
I love the Danner Trail 2650 shoe. This is a variation of that shoe called the campo, same great support in the sole and lightweight. It has been great for short to medium hikes - this version has a fixed tongue. This variation is lower volume and a little narrower. It didn't work for my wide feet but if you're like me, go with the regular version of this shoe.

I also prefer to hike in low running socks and unfortunately I ran into some rubbing around the ankle seam stitching.  If you wear higher socks, this isn't a problem.
review.name: Fixed tongue & rubbing

review.reviewBody:
I just moved to Utah 20 miles up the road from one of the Zion entrances, and that is where I took these shoes on their first spin. I knew when buying them from reading plenty of articles that these have a sock-like fit, without a separate tongue. While yes, this does make it a little tight when you are sliding your foot in, the seal around the ankle when hiking in sand is fantastic! Half of our hike (or more) was on sand or sandy soil, and I got ZERO sand in my shoes. This is also down to the mesh of the upper too. And this was without having any gaiters on, even though this shoe does have the built-in attachment points for gaiters. 

I bought a 7.5 because with a lot of trail runners I've gotten lately I've needed the 7.5 for the room in the toes, but I probably could have gone with a 7 for these. That being said. they still fit fine, without me slipping around. I just have a little more wiggle room for my toes. And the toe protection worked when I accidentally caught my toes on a rock.

The grip was great! Our hike had us crossing a stream bed approximately 50 times (no lie, no exaggeration), and even when the soles were wet, I still had no problems climbing up the rocks on the banks.

Wore them for almost 8 miles of hiking on their first outing and my feet felt just the normal amount of tired. They're very lightweight and give a good ground feel, which I really like (especially as a trail runner), without making your poor feet hurt from feeling every rock.

Cannot speak to durability yet, unfortunately.

Two slightly negative points, but not enough for me to remove a star: 
(1) The laces are almost comically long. I was really worried about them snagging on things. Normally, I do a heel lock lacing (narrow feet and a noticeably smaller right foot), and for that, the extra lace length is great. However, there is not an extra eyelet on these for doing a heel lock. I didn't end up needing a heel-lock lacing anyways though for these to feel snug, probably because of the nice sock-like upper. I ended up ordering some elastic lock laces (which I've done for other shoes, it's not a dig at these ones, it's just a personal preference) and so won't have to worry about long laces snagging.
(2) I like to use superfeet insoles for their extra support, however when I tried them in these shoes, they lifted my heel just enough that I no longer had a good heel lock and was getting a lot of slippage. So I went back to the insoles that came with the shoes. Hopefully they'll hold up well!
review.name: Great light hiker!

review.reviewBody: I liked this shoe a lot. It was comfortable, seemed supportive and looked good, but the tongue is fixed. I find shoes with a fixed tongue difficult to get on and it becomes a bother to me so I returned them. I wouldn?t have purchased them if I?d known about the tongue. Maybe that doesn?t bother you?
review.name: Solid but?

name: Trail 2650 Campo 3in Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol 3/2 GB Steamer Back-Zip Wetsuit - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This is my first full wetsuit and it?s a game changer for me! Darn back injury and chronic arthritis makes swimming challenging for me during the cool winter months. 
This wetsuit really keeps me warm and makes those early morning beach swims and evening upcountry Masters pool swims about as comfortable as they can be!! 
It?s lightweight but heavy enough to insulate! Well constructed and very easy to get on/off. 5?7 3/4? 126lbs size 8 fits beautifully 
Really impressed with the quality!
review.name: Awesome wet suit

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite skirt from Beyond Yoga! Literally fits like a dream and isn't too tight at the waist to eat in. Only thing I will say is I ordered the Darkest night color and when it arrived it was might lighter than the photo. I was looking for something closer to black, and this is most definitely more of a weathered dark grey.
review.name: Darkest Night is *NOT* as black as pictured

review.reviewBody: The movement skirt is my uniform! I have it in navy and black and wear them almost every day because they are so soft and comfortable, flattering, wash well and can be athletic or with a cute top even an out and about town wardrobe piece.
review.name: My uniform!

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and very flattering. Perfect black mini skirt you can workout in or wear out. Worth the price imo
review.name: Worth the price.

review.reviewBody: I love this skort so much. It’s high waisted and short. Super cute on and flattering with crop tops or regular T-shirt. The color is nice and versatile. The fabric is so soft. New favorite summer bottoms. The length is flattering on my legs and love the built in shorts with pockets. Quality seems great! Definitely recommend.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this skirt in white and loved it so much, I bought it in black. It is so soft and comfortable to wear. I'm 5'3 113 lbs and the small fit perfect- Absolutely love the fabric
review.name: Comfortable and cute

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this skirt. Bought two more colors. I do Pilates mat and cardio sculpt classes in it. It’s flattering and comfortable.
review.name: Skirt

review.reviewBody: Love this skirt so much. It’s super comfortable and the undershorts don’t squeeze my thighs like other athletic skirts. Because of this I could move without feeling restricted. The undershorts shorts also have pockets! The material is very butter-like and high quality. I would definitely recommend sizing down because it runs pretty big. Even with sizing down, the length was still perfect.
review.name: buy this skirt!

review.reviewBody: I wear a M in the yoga pants, and I ordered an M in the skirt and it was at least 2 sizes too big. Also the fabric on the inner shorts does not feel like the Spacedye fabric.
review.name: Too large

review.reviewBody: It is so comfortable and flattering... I wear it for golf.
review.name: Favorite skirt

review.reviewBody: XS still very baggy though normally in Beyond I wear pants that are XS or even S and the skirt is such a great idea but it is too big!
review.name: runs large

name: Spacedye Movement Skirt - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Rio Red shoes are gorgeous, color, traction, but they are too narrow, I am 5'5 127lbs I have thin feet, I am 6 1/2 medium size sohes, I ordered 7 wide and still tight, I was hoping the shoes fit but I will have to return them.
review.name: Nice but Narrow

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have hard time looking for boots which fit my bunion feet.  I was a bit worried that these boots felt a bit hard and ridged.  When I wore these boots for the first time, I already had skin scrapes on my feet from waring my water shoes.  On my all day hike through Jamaican bush in Blue Mountain, I had absolutely no pain from my already scraped up feet!!!   I went into shallow creeks and leaned these boots were 100% water proof as they claimed.  One foot fell into a creek to get water inside.  And the boot completely dried out in a day or so to feel a brand new.   Now I am back in NYC, I ware them on my walk around parks or snowy days commute to the office.  They slip on icy snow.  I  wander if there are boots which do not slip on icy snow???  I just love these boots.
review.name: Match made in heaven with my bunion feet

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had these boots for 3 weeks, have slipped on wet rocks multiple times, the last time I fell hard enough I thought I broke my bones.  Description says all terrain grip, not true, wearing these on wet surfaces feels like you're walking on ice which would require me to put cramp ons on the boots to hike safely.
review.name: ZERO TRACTION ON WET SURFACES

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Worn on only 3 day hikes in 10 months, top hook broke when lacing on last time out. Website not allowing and exchange/return?otherwise happy with the boot!!!
Help!!
review.name: They Broke

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Normally wear size 8 wide shoes. I have the Oboz in a low cut hiking shoe size 8.5 and they are a bit loose fitting. I ordered these in 8.5 and they are narrow and too small, my toe hits. Advertised as a wide shoe? I'm sending these back and will try a size 9 and follow up.
review.name: Runs Small

name: Bridger Mid B-Dry Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I got a few packs of trad draws and alpines. The alpines are mini and two packs are light wire. It takes a little getting used to for the minis but once you get some clips it’s not a problem and I like my alpines being mini in comparison it’s easy to identify without looking around harness.
review.name: Accidentally got miniwire

review.reviewBody: When contemplating the very long sport routes at City of Rocks, Idaho, I turned to Black Diamond for a set of MiniWire Quickdraws to supplement my rack. So light weight and easy to clip, they were the best choice for Theater of Shadows on Steinfells Dome. Thank you Black Diamond!
review.name: City of Rocks Must-have!

review.reviewBody: This might just be because I’m used to the heavier and thicker nylon dogbones with higher biners, but I wish both carabiners would have a little more restriction to rolling in the dog bone. Can make clipping when super pumped more difficult.
review.name: Carabiners prone to rotate

review.reviewBody: It’s a black Diamond product. You’re getting the best of the best.
review.name: Fast and light

review.reviewBody: I have climbed using them 10 times already and can say that they are some of my favorite draws I have ever used. They are lightweight and much smaller than the typical draw but are still large enough that my fingers dont get caught when clipping. I was nervous about the size at first as I do have large fingers but they are perfect.
review.name: MiniWire quickdraws

review.reviewBody: super clean and solid build, very light. I often forget I am climbing with them on my side.
review.name: super lightweight

review.reviewBody: Clipping is slightly harder than with sport climbing draws but the weight can't be beat!
they are light weight and work well  compared to others I have used .
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Amazingly light, great for travel and long trad routes when minimizing weight is crucial.
review.name: Great for long trad routes

review.reviewBody: I bought this several weeks ago and they are awesome! My go to.
review.name: Lightweight & Awesome

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a number of Zoic and TLD shorts and have had those always rip or tear easily ( especially ZOIC, they’re super fragile ) After logging a season in these, from desert riding to downhill, I can say I’d buy them again and again. They stretch very well, and are extremely durable. Backcountry makes a solid product.
review.name: Awesome Shorts!

review.reviewBody:
I first bought the shorter inseam Slickrock bike shorts, and loved their fabric and quality of construction, but not their length. Upon learning of these 11 inch inseam Empire bike shorts I ordered a pair - and they are everything I could have hoped for! First, the number and arrangement of the pockets is much superior to the shorter Slickrock bike shorts. I like the way my phone sits in the Empire side pockets much better - as in the Slickrock my phone bulges from the front too much. Second, the Empire uses a Velcro waitband adjustment, much cleaner and neater than the strap on the Slickrock shorts. Lastly, the inseam - 11 inches is perfect when walking, standing and especially while riding. I’ve gone on to buy more pairs and the Empire shorts as I use them for everything now. As for the shorter Sliickrock shorts? They live on doing yeomans duty as my indoor workout shorts - where carrying a phone is not necessary and where their shorter length and larger air vent holes are helpful.

Only improvement I could suggest for the Empire shorts are for air vent holes as large as those on the Slickrock bike shorts. The Empir shorts have smaller vent holes.
review.name: I Like Long Shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts feel and fit great. My only critique is the pockets. The pockets are a little short. But I try not to keep much in my pockets on bike rides and they do have a side zipper pocket. I do need my phone on my though and it sticks out of the pocket slightly. Not a big issue but that is the only fault I can provide.
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: Handsome design, great colors (calla and sunflower), comfy in many conditions.  I logged back in and bought more! Note: sunflower fig perfectly and calla is noticeably tighter, but serviceable. They wash and dry well. They’re my new favorite shorts!
review.name: Everybody loves my Empire shorts

name: Empire Bike Short - Men's

I'm happy with these pedals. The colors are fantastic and quality feels great. The pins don't feel as grippy as other pedals I've used (Deity Bladerunner, VP Vice) but I haven't seen that affect me much on the trail. There's been a couple odd rocky climbs where a foot bounced off but where it matters on the descent I've felt locked in.

Durability has yet to be tested.
review.name: I'm Happy With These Pedals

review.reviewBody: Still new so not sure how they'll wear, but they have a great platform & grip. And look super dope in purple!
review.name: Great Comp Pedals

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend these pedals. I have much more expensive Crankbros flat pedals, all metal, and i prefer these.
review.name: Great pedals, great price

review.reviewBody: For the price these are hands-down the best MTB pedals out there. Nice big platform supports even larger feet (mens 11), pins are super grippy without being unnecessarily long, they offer rebuild kits for the bearings and pins if you ever need to service them, they have a thin profile to help prevent pedal-strikes. and if you do pedal-strike it's much less noticeable than aluminum pedals. Highly recommend.
review.name: Best pedals for the money

review.reviewBody: Great pedals. Very sturdy and stable grip. Attractive look and great durability. My feel feel very study on those pedals. Great for mountaine biking
review.name: very sturdy grip for shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice pedal for dirt, but the two small windows are snow traps, in which large icebergs form.   Stay with a more open pedal for winter fatbiking..I'll be going back to my chesters
review.name: Not for winter fat biking

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these after switching to flats and liked them so much I bough another pair for my sons bike. They hold up to abuse and work great. A very good entry level pedal. I have probably put over 1000 miles on a pair with no problems.
review.name: Super grippy and durable

review.reviewBody: I bought these for obvious reasons. I should have listened to the reviews that said they squeak, because sure enough with two weeks of riding they started to make noise. I returned the pedals- bummed!
review.name: Squeaks!

review.reviewBody: Should have upgraded from the cheap pedals that came on my rockhopper day one. Waaaaay more efficient pedaling these. No joke, They took 7 minutes off a two mile trail I ride regularly.
review.name: No brainer

review.reviewBody: Got a set of these pedals on both my bikes. Extremely grippy makes you feel very planted on the bike. Have many friends that ride my bike and want to buy the same pedals.
review.name: Quality product!

name: Composite Pedal

review.reviewBody: I normally love the S-Works tires but not so much for the turbo edition. The grip and ride is excellent on the tire. However, when I flatted recently it took myself and a kind (and strong) cyclist who happened to stop and help, 45 minutes to get the turbo onto the rim. The fit is extraordinarily tight and almost impossible to get onto my Royal rims...thus the poor rating. Buy the standard (non-Turbo) version of the tire.

review.reviewBody: Thought I’d try this jersey to go with the Pearl Izumi Expedition Pro bibs. Absolutely love the bibs, but the jersey sucks. It’s way too small in the shoulders and not long enough in the front. I have an athletic, muscular build and usually wear a medium or large in tops. Larges are usually too big in the waist, but fit my shoulders. Mediums usually fit everywhere except the shoulders. Grrr. I bought a large in this jersey and guess what? It was too small all over. The shoulders were way too tight, and the front of the jersey barely reached my belly button.  It was uncomfortably tight, even for a cycling jersey. I could have exchanged for an XL, but believe the larger size would have still been too short in the front. Really disappointed since I liked the fabric and features of this jersey.
review.name: Way too small!

name: Expedition Jersey - Women's

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Big Cottonwood Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Big Cottonwood Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Big Cottonwood Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Don't bother buying this shirt unless you love to iron. I bought 2 of these and they fold and crinkle up in numerous places. I have far cheaper shirts that require less attention than these. These require consistent and aggressive ironing after each wash and seem to get worse with each wash. I am very disappointed in these shirts.
review.name: Don't Bother

review.reviewBody: Nice short sleeve shirt acquired on a season ending sale.
review.name: Big Cottonwood Shirt

review.reviewBody: More muted in color than the online image. Think ol’man Havana button down.
review.name: Color- ?

review.reviewBody: I wanted something similar to a "slim fit" shirt, since I hate baggy, body-distorting clothes. This was the perfect fit—snug where it needed to be, but without feeling restrictive. The pattern is great, too.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Shirt wears well, the material is slightly abrasive on the skin but not annoyingly so. It just appears to be well constructed and not flexible like I had assumed.  Overall a great business, casual, outdoor shirt.
review.name: Short and Sweet

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Big Cottonwood shirt in the Raw Clay Plaid color for summer hiking. Loved the color but the size small was oversized. I'm 5'5", 142 lbs., slim, athletic build. The shoulder seam was about an inch too long, the body width was overly wide and the length about an inch too long. In comparison, I own the Kor Preshell Hoody size small which has a nice trim fit. The material was a nice lightweight cotton which seemed perfect for my needs.
review.name: Oversized Fit

name: Big Cottonwood Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I was skeptical that this lightweight Houdini could really help in any way but I couldn't resist trying it so I bought the color on sale and off I went, into a brisk wind, storm clouds coming in, and 40 degrees.

I wore a light base top and a very light fleece vest and topped it all off with the Houdini.  I started walking and thought I would probably have to go back after a short walk due to getting too cold in the strong wind.  

But this super lightweight thing that feels like a tent actually worked to block the wind!  What?!  I was very impressed and could have kept on walking if not for darkness coming over my trail.  

Great product, not only for runners.  I think I will be able to keep this on without ever getting too hot.  It's almost not really there but then when the wind blows, it turns into a super power tool and feels like being in your tent.  

I got a size up.  Normally I wear a large.  I like the sleeve length because I can tuck my hands in at the ends until I warm up.  There is a drawstring stretch cord at the base.  Personally I don't like chest pockets so I'll ignore that and maybe cut off the little pull cord on it.  I do like the big center zip that makes this an Anorak.  There are two front pockets with a velcro closure which could hold a mitten or tissue but they don't really work for your phone because the jacket is super light and the phone pulls it down.  

Overall I am happy and wish I could have a second one in another color.
review.name: Wow, it works

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Thule truck rack about a month ago that came with one set of load stops. The load stops however would not fit onto the Thule track? So a friend of mine machined them to fit.
I order another set a couple weeks back and received them the day before my road trip. They too did not slide onto the truck rack. I am debating sending them back or have my friend machine them as well...

Not sure why neither set fit but it's pretty disappointing when you are all set for a road trip with kayak board and bike in hand only to find the load stops are not compatible with the Thule truck rack.

Not sure how to rate this - disappointed
review.name: Frustrating

review.reviewBody: This load stop is presented beneath the product page for the Probars, with a heading that indicates the pictured accessories are compatible with the Probar. The picture shown with the load stops does not show a probar in use. The probar's top slopes downward. The loadstop writeup states "Compatible with Thule AeroBlade, Thule Rapid Aero, Thule Xsporter Pro, Thule Xsporter and Thule TracRac 'XT' Aluminum bars (sold separately)." So, IS the load stop compatible with the probar? I need 79" bar length so I'm stuck with the Probar. What will work with it???
review.name: Compatibility?
comment:
Hello Craig,

I'm sorry that the distinction was not more clear. Based on your feedback, we've also included the Thule ProBar in the "Features" section of the product page, not just the "Technical Specifications" along with the other crossbar systems the Thule Aero Load Stops are compatible with.

review.reviewBody: The Thule website specifically states that the Aero Load Stops 502 are not compatible with the Thule Wingbar Evo crossbars. One online retailer stated that the Thule Load Stops they stock, with a different product number, are compatible with the Wingbar Evos. This is definitely not the case. I was mislead by the product number, thinking that this was a Load Stop design that was compatible with my crossbars. Thule needs to develop more accessories that will fit the Wingbar Evos! At a minimum they should provide T-bolts in various lengths that will slide into the Wingbar Evo T-slots.
review.name: Check compatibility with your Thule cross bars!
comment:
Thank you for reaching out! I'm sorry to hear that you received some incorrect compatibility information from your local Thule dealer. 
Unfortunately, the Thule Aero Load Stops are not compatible with Thule WingBar Evo because the metal in the crossbar is thicker than that of the prior Thule AeroBlade system. 
The complete list of crossbar systems the load stops are compatible with is available in the Technical Specifications on the product page.

review.reviewBody: I purchased not 1 set, but 2 sets as I was impressed with the design of these load stops, that I decided to purchase another set of racks for the cab of my F150 CrewCab and made my aluminum boat more secure on top!
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: Can’t say enough positive things about these load stops.  Had mine for over 20 years and absolutely love them!!!!
review.name: Awesome peace of mind

review.reviewBody: These stops work great for securing 2 canoes on top of my truck and they were so valuable to keep the canoes secured while driving through numerous miles of powerful crosswinds.
review.name: Thule end stops - They?re great product!

review.reviewBody: Is it possible that my new load stops are not compatible with my Thule rack?
review.name: Incompatable

review.reviewBody: unacceptable that when you order more as the other ones fell off that you get the load stop but no bolt or knob. luckily I was able to find the knob to order but not the bolt.
review.name: load stop

review.reviewBody: I was very disappointed with how small the load stops were height wise I’m a plumber when I carry pipe on the truck I need taller load stops. I had load stops from thule in 2012 They were much taller I don’t know why they’re so small I would never get those again if there’s a different option I would prefer that
review.name: Load stop

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of Zero Gravity tights - they're the only thing I run in. review.itemreviewed: Zero Gravity 7/8 Illuminate Run Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: LOVE these! Bought them to run the Royal Parks Half because I was getting friction rubbing from my other leggings. They are super smooth and comfy. review.reviewBody: Bought these for travel as we typically stay in AirBnB or VRBO cabins several times a year. My kids said I should buy a set of travel knives because I always complain about the knives where we stay. The next day the CampChef ad appeared on my web browser for these knives.....hmmmm..... but to the point, great knives, very sturdy, very sharp and a well thought out selection.

review.reviewBody: Loved the knife set! Loved it enough to buy a set for each of my brothers. Great set, convenient,  plus a caring case.

review.reviewBody: So far these knives are sharp! Very happy with the first initial edge on them but will be able to tell more once they have been used. But for the price they’re great.
review.name: Sharpness

review.reviewBody: Great assortment of cutlery.  Perfect for every foreseeable task when out on a camping boondoggle.  Although the knife carrying case is made of decent material, I had to give four stars because the carrying case Velcro wraps for securing the knife tips were not all correctly placed or large enough to secure the tips of some of the knives (even when using the online CampChef photos which show which knives go where within the carrier).  Also, the provided nets on the carrier (which are supposed to hold the knife handles) are very snug and the netting catches on the rubber grips on the knives so that they do not slide in smoothly without a lot of jimmying and finger plucking of the netting until they are finally in place.  Once they are in place, they are secure -- but as stated before, some of the knife tips will not be fully secure.  However, once the carrier is folded over and secured (with the sewn in clips), everything is safely out of site and contained within the carrier--so there is no danger of being cut once the carrier is closed up; just be careful when opening the carrier.  [Note:  It is best to lay the knife carrier on a flat surface when opening it.  This should be done in order to reduce the risk of any knives falling out and cutting you.  By laying the carrier on a flat surface and opening it, you will be more than safe.).  To fix the problem with the insertion of the rubber handles into the netting compartments, I used scissors to cut out little plastic rectangles from the plastic packaging that the knives came in.  I inserted those rectangles into the netting pockets and trimmed them to ensure they were long enough to extend from the top to the bottom of the pockets without sticking out of the net pockets.  This little trick allowed the knives to slide smoothing into the pockets without getting hung up in the netting.  Once in place, the knives were able to be set deep within the pockets so that they were securely stowed away.
review.name: Knife Set

review.reviewBody: Chef knife handle broke and I haven't even had it for a year
review.name: Its ok

name: 9 Piece Professional Knife Set

review.reviewBody: I tried this new style thinking it may be the same as my lone peaks . I should have listened to all of the reviews, they were 100% on . Way too tight , and I have small narrow feet. Need to return
review.name: Not even close to the lone peak mids

review.reviewBody: Worn for 3 hikes only. I did a 9 mile hike that had rough terrain, loose big rocks & partial climbing. The foam trim had chunks of material come off. Really disappointed on the quality tho it's waterproof
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a backpacking trip and was testing them out inside. The inner ankle where the tongue is connected is hard and rubs the ankle bone. I tried different ways to tie them to put less pressure on the ankle and it did not help the pain. I even tried a thicker sock and no luck. I am really disappointed because they are super comfortable if not for the horrible ankle bone rubbing.
review.name: Rubs the Ankle Bone Terribly

review.reviewBody: I bought these for hotter climate like Arches, Bryce, and Zion parks to hike and for longer distances. Unbelievable comfortable and lots of traction I needed. Love these!
review.name: The best hiking shoes for Bryce National Park

review.reviewBody: I want to love them. They are extremely light and the ankles feel supportive without digging. Unfortunately they are a half size too small for me. I was also disappointed to see they arrived dirty and scuffed, with muddy soles and dog hair inside and out.
review.name: Arrived scuffed and muddy with bits of dog hair.

review.reviewBody: Finally found a hiking boot that works for my wide foot and narrow heel! So comfortable... feels like wearing a running shoe. But has the support, durability, GTX and traction I like for hiking on snow, ice, and dirt. And waterproof + zero drop too! Lace system makes it easy to adjust for different socks. Just feels good to wear, which I have not yet found in a hiking boot. And I have tried a lot!
review.name: Love this hiking boot! Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: I wore these hikers during my recent trip to Northern California. My feet stayed dry during heavy downpours of rain on trail hikes and walking on the beach. My only problem was the tongue on my left shoe rubbed against my ankle. I wore thicker socks and that helped the situation.
review.name: Nice waterproof hiker

review.reviewBody: At first I loved these shoes. On my first day they were comfy and hadn't been tested in the rain. After riding my bike for 30 minutes in the rain my feet were soaked on top. I looked inside the shoe and felt the tongue and saw the watermark. The tongue, which is a substantial part of the top of the shoe is NOT waterproof. I don't understand why this isn't a waterproof tongue? It's false advertising. 2 Stars just because they are comfy.
review.name: Not waterproof (the tongue got soaked and then my feet)

name: Timp Hiker GTX Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been using the Questar™ 20F/-6C Sleeping Bag on several camping trips now, and it has exceeded my expectations every time. The warmth and comfort it provides, even in colder conditions, are impressive. The fit is cozy without feeling restrictive, and the materials feel high-quality and durable.

One feature that stood out to me is the SynergyLink™ connectors, which kept the bag securely in place on my sleeping pad throughout the night, preventing any cold spots. I also appreciate the ThermoCapture™ lining that effectively reflects body heat, making this bag a true lifesaver on colder nights.

Setting it up and packing it away is a breeze, and it compresses well for easy storage in my backpack. Whether I’m car camping or backpacking, this bag has become my go-to for any adventure where I need reliable warmth and comfort.
review.name: Perfect Companion for Chilly Nights!

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable sleeping bag I've ever owed! Roomy for a 6'2" guy who likes to sleep on his side.
review.name: Very Comfortable Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: The COMFORT range on this sleeping bag is 32°F/0°C. So, that means that your average person will be comfortable at those temps. Simply put, this is a 3-season bag. If you're looking for a 4-season bag, then do your research and buy a bag that is a rated comfort level for subzero temps (Polar Ranger). This is an awesome bag for what it is designed to do. Don't buy a bag with clearly defined ratings, expecting it to perform differently... And then give it a poor review. I own 6 Therm-A-Rest sleeping bags and 2 quilts, and they all perform as rated. I do 95% of my camping in very cold temps and these bags have performed to standard.
review.name: READ the Temperature rating before leaving a review

review.reviewBody:
I like this bag very much, I used it for almost a year non-stop on a long-distance bike tour and was super comfortable in 99 % of the nights. I do have to say that it is losing a few feathers that are poking through the fabric and the downs are not perfectly distributed/ some light shining through in some places. In the colder nights (the coldest being around -4 °C) I did have to wear socks, thermo underpants and a fleece in order not to freeze. But since the comfort temp is stated at 0 °C and -6 °C is the limit, I think that's pretty fair.
The fabric feels super soft and comfortable and I'm a huge fan of the Synergy Link Connectors. I used the bag with a Trail Pro mattress in regular size, but recently upgraded to a NeoAir XLite - unfortunately I didn't check the width of the Trail Pro (53 cm) and ordered a large XLite with 64 cm. The connectors are way too tight with this one and I'd be afraid to tear the bag if I slept in it with the wide mattress attached. I don't know why Thermarest doesn't offer longer straps as an aftermarket option, since it's a bit pointless to offer this kind of feature (which again, I'm a huge fan of in principle), but then make it incompatible with wider mattresses of their own product line.
review.name: Pretty good with room for improvement

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight down bag. Was warmer than expected and held up to its temp rating. It has a few more features than necessary but parts are removable. Lots of room inside for side sleepers like myself.
review.name: Great backpacking bag

review.reviewBody: After waiting 3 months (the entire summer) for a repair to my brand-new sleeping bag, Therm-A-Rest finally sent back the bag, saying it had been fixed. However, the tear in the sewing was still there, untouched. They basically kept my bag for 3 months and re-stashed it in a box (not even in the storing bag) without looking at it. What I was considering to be a bad luck when I bought this bag turned out to be a real lack of professionalism from a company that "has a very robust warranty and stands behind [their] product". If you are searching for a high-quality product, I can only recommend going somewhere else.
review.name: Update to my initial review on 07/02/23

review.reviewBody: Been using this bag for a year now. Warmer conditions it’s fine. But anything close to 30° or lower plan on freezing. I always have to add a liner and layers of clothing to stay warm. You can take a flashlight and see the down is not evenly distributed or none in some places.
review.name: Love /hate this bag

review.reviewBody: Went on 35 days of wilderness canoe trips covering 500+ miles of Canada this summer and couldn’t have asked for a better bag. Temp regulation is great, when it’s hot, doesn’t feel too hot, when you’re hypothermic, this thing immediately warmed me up. Bag dries quickly when damp. Truly couldn’t have gotten a better bag, little pricy, but can tell this will last me a long time.
review.name: Best Bag

review.reviewBody: Super cozy and warm, zippers work quite well, and plenty of room for your feet. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody:
This is without a doubt one of the easiest reviews I will write. 

Pros:
The fabric is as smooth as butter making a lovely nights rest! The bag itself is plenty toasty (lowest I've taken this bag to is 28 degrees) 

Plenty of leg room to stretch out a bit while the bag is fully zipped

repels a bit of water (single wall tent unfortunately drenched me but hey, I stayed dry in my bag at least!)

and best of all packs down to about the size of a 32oz Nalgene bottle! 

Cons:
None at this moment! Maybe the fact that I didn't get the 0F bag? Highly recommend this bag!
review.name: Sliced bread has some competition

review.reviewBody:
Over all I love these boots, light, easy on and off, great  grip with stud, and they have help up well. My only criticism is the web shoe lace eyes seen to be a little light. 
They have started to fray a little and one of them has torn through. I would have given a 4 1/2 but couldn’t, they are still a great boot.
review.name: Over all a great boot

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, lightweight wading boot. Great for long hikes in the river
review.name: Great looking and durable lightweight wading boot

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for in a lower profile boot to move around rivers with greater freedom from a heavier wading boot. Fit is true, comfortable, and performs well on all wading situations. Great product!
review.name: Excellent Lightweight low profile wading boot!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic wading boots! Lightweight and low profile provides good ankle support and dexterity while boulder hopping compared to a high profile  boot. Love the option for felt bottom soles as the waters in the mountains of Asheville, North Carolina can get pretty slick. Thanks for another great product Simms!
review.name: Fantastic lightweight low profile wading boots!

review.reviewBody: Another great Simms product!  Fit is perfect (ordering one size larger than usual footwear).  The wading shoes are definitely “flyweight” very comfortable and really grip the Stream bottom.  Many thanks folks at Simms . . .
review.name: Great Flyweight Wading Shoes

review.reviewBody: Great fishing boot and easy to travel long distances in!
Fantastic boots, this is what I use on slick, cold, larger round rock creek bottoms and it holds so good.
review.name: Fantastic boots

review.reviewBody: Light enough for waling and wet wading, but also sturdy.  I especially like that a D-ring to attach gravel guards is included.  I wish more boots had that feature.
review.name: Light weidht, comfortable, and ssturdy

review.reviewBody: Put studs in felt. Great boots. Comfortable and it’s the safest I’ve felt wading in a long time.

These are the most comfortable and convenient set of lightweight wading shoes for warm weather I have ever used.  They are a breeze to get on and off incredibly light weight.  I would strongly recommend them to any angler.
review.name: Wow

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Kunai Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kunai Tent: 3-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Kunai Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For the light weight, this is perfect for 4-season use.  If you only can buy one tent and need a 4-season option, this is it.  Be prepared to add/replace guylines and add light stakes or build snow anchors, but I have no problem with that.  We have weather tested this in wind, heavy rain (with added guy outs, required), and light snow.  Very minimal, insignificant fly sagging.  We haven't had it in heavy snow so cannot speak to that.  I imagine it would require some snow removal maintenance as many do, due to the pitch angle of the roof line.  However for the insane low weight, I'll deal with it.  It's a palace of space inside for my husband and I (both close to 6') and our 73# dog and gear.  OK, the single smallish vestibule means not much space there for our gear, so consider that.  I love the ability to adjust venting from the inside!  Good job, NEMO.
review.name: Awesome for the compromise piece it is

review.reviewBody: Another Kunai user recmnd and so far so good. Easy setup, though wish there was a downloadable video on the website for cellphone storage as a field reference. My only complaint as a new user is failure to provide specifics of separate guy line placement for tent & rain cover. Many reviews complain about insufficient stakes and my tent came with no guy lines though they are supposed to be included. Frustrating omission for a tent at this price point IMHO.
review.name: Great Design, Field Test in Patagonia Coming Soon

review.reviewBody: excellente tents. Perfect in rain and very high winds
review.name: Mountain camping Ecuador

name: Kunai Tent: 3-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this iron many times over the last 2 years. It has shown no wear. It has very even heat and a rheostat to control the temperature. This allows you to dial in the correct temperature for the wax of the day.   One note of caution. The base is heavy and dense so don’t put it away before it has plenty of time to cool down. And treat the base carefully as it is ez to scratch. My only complaint is it’s difficult to read the temps on the dial. I marked mine with a sharpie to make it easy to read.

hasVariant.name: Lagos 25L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Lagos 25L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lagos 25L Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Lagos 25L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love the bag. I think it has a lot going well for it. There’s one change I’d change to it to make it a really good bag. I’d make a pouch for the hydration pack in the bag. I hate how it just hangs there and blocks you from getting into anything from underneath it. I had the lagos 15 and I’d thought it would be exactly like that but was surprised and disappointed when it wasn’t. I think you change that and the Lagos 25 becomes a great bag. 
 The rest of the bag is great. The materials are constructed well. I love the mesh you guys use. It has a lot of pockets. It’s a comfortable bag. Just add a pouch in the back of the bag for the hydration pack and this becomes a great bag
review.name: Great bag with one flaw

review.reviewBody: Setup/layout perfect for traveling as well as hiking.
review.name: Great travel bag

review.reviewBody: This has become my go-to hacking pack, rain, snow, or shine. I wanted waist straps and a hydration bag and I love that about this pack. Also love the hydration bag design, the magnet for the water tube on the front, the soft lining of the small pocket, and the fact that my phone can go in the mesh side pocket easily so I can grab it for photos or to check AllTrails easily.
review.name: Love this pack so much I bought it twice!

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this pack except the structure/back panel. It’s too flimsy. I put a Nalgene in the main compartment & could not wear it due to it digging into my back. This pack will work for carrying light & soft items but for its size it’s not a great hiking pack. I’ll still use it for other things though because I like the look & all the compartments.
review.name: Great looking pack

review.reviewBody: Bought the pack prepping for long hikes in the Southwest and just recently hiked Arches and Bryce Canyon. The bag was snug but not tight. Held up perfectly to being dragged along the rock faces. I loved the compartments to stow all the nonsense you need for a hike. Makes packing for outdoors trips a breeze and is dependable.
review.name: This ain’t your daddy’s hydropack.

review.reviewBody:
Lagos 25L Hiking Hydration Pack from Cotopaxi:
Overall Fit: True to size as a 25L Hydration Backpack, falls well for 5'5" body frame
Used Pack for Day Hikes in Colorado, where weather can be in the 80*'s to snowing all in the same hike!
Pack was bought because of its bright colors (a plus if lost - both the pack and person!), size, multiple pockets, durability, capacity, comfortable straps, and Cotopaxi's mission statement. It can also be used for carry-on for airplane travel.
Lifestyle: Weekend Warrior, and Travel Junkie :)
review.name: Awesome and Versatile Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: i loved it, i recently took it on a hike and it was great
review.name: backpack

review.reviewBody: Very nice fit and comfortable. Like the multiple pockets and compartments
review.name: Lagos

review.reviewBody: Need a new cute backpack and for me Cotopaxi Lagos 25L is the answer. Comfy, yet lightweight enough, small enough for carryon, and will bring this to Bali trip, camping in Hong Kong and Kilimanjaro hike!
review.name: Love this backpack!

review.reviewBody: I know they are not expensive to pick up a generic replacement bladder but I was pretty disappointed to spend so much on a backpack and not get a bladder. Otherwise, I have liked it. It has been great to hike with. I still need to get a bladder. I’ve just been throwing water bottles in there.
review.name: My backpack didn’t come with a bladder

name: Lagos 25L Hydration Pack

review.name: Dye lot doesn’t match

review.reviewBody:
They are good pants, vents work, they keep the cold out, and moisture too.
They crinkle when you move. The legs are long, and I am not.
Other than that, it all works. There's a pocket and anchor for your beacon, and function of everything is spot on. Snap em up people. I'm going to jem mine and talk more so I don't hear the crinkle.
review.name: Pretty nice pants.

review.reviewBody:
THUNDER THIGHS APPROVED. 10/10 this gets 4 stars due to the fit and warmth. 
Pro skiers that stay on their feet will definitely appreciate these. 
If your like me and often find your skis in the pattern of a helicopter, surrounded by a dust bowl of fresh Pow, 10 Din letting, go losing both sticks and face down in the snowpack, I wouldn’t recommend. The rip stop is holding well, but without the protective effect of the legendary pants - or other “ski” oriented pants, it’s tough to give 5 stars for ski pants that don’t hold well against the edge of a fresh pair of Armada’s, Rossi’s, or Atomics. I have several razor cuts along the bottom from both my sticks and other riders who have come in and taken me out at Mach speed. 
BUY FOR WARMTH AND FIT AT THE BOTTOM OF THE HILL WITH THE PLATINUM BLONDES AND IPA BREWS.
review.name: FIT PERFECT/DURABILITY EHHH

review.reviewBody: I am 5'11", 215 lb with big thighs.  I bought both the Sogn and the Legendary Insulated Pant (LIP) in a LARGE.  I am a 35-36" waist but need good room in the butt and thighs.  The LIP is a bit thinner (less insulated) than the Sogn but a less roomy fit (skinny fit).  The Sogn seems to have more room in the waist, thighs and butt.  I am keeping the Sogn and returning the LIP.  Have fun out there.
review.name: Sogn Cargo Pant - better for *Not Skinny

name: Sogn Cargo Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Only a couple of rides so far but good grip and comfort.   Looks nice on the bike.   Easy to install and seems strong/tough.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: Am very happy with result. I can't recall if I've ever wrapped drop bars before. It was a little nerve wracking trying to follow along with the several videos I watched... getting the wrap direction correct, how to navigate the "figure-8" at brake levers, how to splice in the short cut piece, how much tape to leave at beginning and end, how much overlap, etc.  But in the end I just went for it.  It looks nice. High quality materials. Much cushier/ thicker than the stock wrap. So, I need to adjust my lever throw rest positions using the set screws... then adjust brake cable at calipers.  Yet another opportunity to learn about my bike... which is always a good thing. In coinclusion, great product. Would buy again. Might go for Ergon's road bike (less thick) tape versus gravel tape for next install on my Salsa Warbird gravel bike.  But will get a few seasons' use out of this wrap first.
review.name: Looks good installed!

name: BT Gravel Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have multiple pairs that are great for day-to-day wear. Also, a must for traveling. Comfortable, quick drying material. Sturdy waist band keeps in place through a variety of activities. Highly recommend recommended.
review.name: These boxers are great for day-to-day wear/travel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I originally bought for travel. But they were so comfortable, I just kept buying more until these also became my every day wear.
review.name: Excellent for travel and every

review.reviewBody: It's nice that someone understands how to make men's underwear with a waistband that's not rolling down constantly. Finally. That in and of itself is a major plus. But overall, I really love it. In fact so much I got my first pair in and just washed it every day till the second order came in. It stretches, it breathes, it dries really fast. I can sweat in the gym and then by the time I get in the truck and am home... it's already dry. The legs don't ride up - although I prefer the 3" version so I just ordered that, but the 5 inch version is great for wearing pants. They stay put, just the right stretch but also just the right hold... definitely a fan, and I'm SUPER picky about clothing. I got a large, even though my waist is 33 but I didn't want it to be constrictive as I have larger quads, so if you work out a lot, I'd go up a size - however it's still incredibly comfortable.
review.name: Have to say I really love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My favorite underwear.  Great for everyday and especially great for travel.  Packs down to nothing (helpful when camping), and dries quickly when laundered.
review.name: Great deal for a great product

review.reviewBody: While the material holds up the waist wears out quickly and once that fails these become expensive "disposable" boxers
review.name: Elastic waist failure

review.reviewBody: I'm submitting this review while this product is both fresh on my mind and on my behind! They are awesome and make me feel like I'm strolling through a crisp fall breeze. Get a pair...for your pair! Seriously, you won't regret this purchase.
review.name: All I hoped and dreamed for!

review.reviewBody: This is the best boxer I've ever had! So comfortable and soft. I have had a lot of luck with Exofficio and imagine these will be just as durable.
review.name: Comfy and Durable

review.reviewBody: Great fit and fabric. Super comfortable and really breathable. Great for sleeping. This is my second round of buying these. My favorite boxers now.
review.name: Great fit, fabric, function

review.reviewBody: I don’t like the fit nearly as much as the original Give-N-Go’s. They constantly ride up my legs. Honestly, I wish I hadn’t made the purchase. It will be my last.
review.name: Failed to improve on original

review.reviewBody: ExOffficio now has a "2.0 Boxer".  I'd kill to have the old 1.0 back.  I find the new material clingy, slick, and more like women's underware than men's.  The old 1.0 version was light and had texture.  A much preferred feature than the current "improvement".  If ExOfficio has any of the old 1.0 boxers in the warehouse in an XL, please let me know so I can stock up.
review.name: 1.0 Boxers, WHERE ARE YOU??

name: Give-N-Go 2.0 Boxer - 2-Pack - Men's

review.name: Industry’s BEST Shovel

review.reviewBody: easy to use, very strong, extremely lightweight. this is a great shovel to carry in the backcountry or have in your car just in case.
review.name: solid shovel

review.reviewBody: I’ve broken my share of shovels (will not mention brands) but the BD Evac line is about as tough and ergonomic to use as they come. IMO it’s worth the extra $$ when you know you can rely on it.
review.name: Professional Grade

review.reviewBody: Sturdy build, basic in a good way. Exactly what you need
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: Great shovel. Lightweight and compact enough for carrying around but still feels sturdy enough to get the job done.
review.name: Sturdy Compact Shovel

review.reviewBody: This is the best shovel out there. When your buddy is under the snow you want the biggest and best this is it. Hoe move let’s you move a ton of snow quickly and the handle helps you dig harder and faster
review.name: Fantastic shovel

review.reviewBody: Shovel is too large and funny shaped for human powered activities and a small pack. I tried, and benched it. I used it in hoe mode to shovel a roof and I wish I had it years ago for that. This thing moves tons of snow with less effort. A must have for the car, snowmobile or any time you need to move a buttload of snow
review.name: Best shovel ever but...

review.reviewBody: Sturdy and well built. I like how easy it switches to a hoe
review.name: My favorite avalanche shovel so far

review.reviewBody: Just getting into touring, this shovel is massive but still fits will in my pack. It's not quite as lightweight as some of the options with speed holes in it, but this isn't an item worth skimping on. Feels like it will hold up to years of abuse and the mechanism that connects the handle to the shovel is quick and intuitive.
review.name: First Shovel

review.reviewBody: Great shovel! I bought this to stow in my trunk as part of my winter car kit. I look forward to the first chance to use it to either dig myself out of a parking spot, or to clear a spot to park in.

review.reviewBody: I've used these skins twice now and they are good for the first climb.  After that, they do not stick to my skis very well.  I am not impressed with the hybrid glue technology.  They are light weight and climb OK.  But if they do not stick to the bottom of the skis, it doesn't matter what their weight is.  Very disappointed!
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I haved used these skins for a season in the wasatch back, utah.  They are a good balance of glide, grip, weight and stiffness.  Recommended.
review.name: Good balance of characteristics

review.reviewBody: First time ever touring this year. I've used these twice so far. Haven't slipped or had any issues on glide. I originally wanted POMOCA skins, but local shop mentioned that BCA released these brand new this year. Glad I went with these. You won't regret this purchase!
review.name: First time tourer

review.reviewBody: Once I had these skins trimmed and sized to my skis, I was blown away with how easily they pulled apart.  And as a result, I was immediately sceptical of their ability to stick to my ski bases.  Thing is...they did.  And they actually did it really well.  Lap after lap after lap.  The mohair mix offers the perfect balance of grip and glide.  They also pack up very efficiently and don't hog a lot of room in my coat or pack.  Lastly, it's worth mentioning BCA's trim tool that comes included with these skins.  It rules!  Best trim tool out there.  It's precise, predictable, and super comfortable in the hand.  I know it's a minor detail, but it really leave an impression.
review.name: The Hype Is Real!

name: Contour Hybrid Climbing Skins

description: Buy the Black Diamond Impulse 112 Ski - 2024 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Impulse 112 Ski - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Impulse 112 Ski - 2024 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like others have said, the all-around abilities of the 112 are impressive. Outside of hard pack, they shred everything. Stable, carvable, not hard to get on edge and obviously plenty of float for the deep stuff. I think their most impressive attribute is how quick they are- amazing for skiing tight lines or raiding power stashes in the trees. Isn’t that what we are usually skiing inbounds anyway? BD- please make a lightweight version for your widest touring ski!!!
review.name: Soft snow rippers

review.reviewBody: The Impulse lineup is underrated. I have the Impulse 104 as a one ski quiver and went with the 112 for a go to powder ski for those deeper days. Both sets have a set of Fritschi Tecton 13 touring binding. Black Diamond finally hit the mark with a frontside, side country, light touring, all mountain, freeski do it anything ski...I live mine!
review.name: BD Impulse lineup

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'3 about 190ish and the 112/ 186 is the way to go. These ski's are my Touring set up, but they've seen some resort skinning days and lift rides. For such a big underfoot ski, these thing can really get up on the edge. They ski all conditions I've thrown at them very well. Highly recommend these skis.
review.name: Even better than expected!

review.reviewBody: This ski does everything for me. From powering through choppy hard pack to powder days, I’ve never had a complaint with these. 112 is the perfect width and really can get the job done day in and day out.
review.name: Amazing Ski

review.reviewBody: Ski those last winter as a demo. They were so fun but still so powerful. Kind of a perfect balance between big mountain ski that is hard charging and still fun playful inbounds... Really liked it
review.name: AMAZING

name: Impulse 112 Ski - 2024

hasVariant.name: Nuuk Parka - Men's

hasVariant.name: Nuuk Parka - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Nuuk Parka - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Nuuk Parka last month knowing full well that the zipper would probably cause me heartburn. And, it is bothersome! But, I love the coat! It is sturdy, well-built and has a bunch of pockets. The zipper issue still bugs me. I understanding that Europeans traditionally have the male zipper opposite of what Americans are used to and I can live with that. It’s not my first European coat. But, the actual zipper is more difficult to use than it should be. With as much effort as the company puts into designing their clothing, you would think they could improve this more than they have. That notwithstanding, I love the coat and will use it for many years.
review.name: Perfect - minus the Zipper!

review.reviewBody: I have had this coat for a full season, and main zipper is impossible to start.  Something wrong with the design.  Tons of pockets, and very warm for Minnesota.
review.name: Agree about the zipper

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket 7 years ago, and I almost look forward to the cold, snowy weather so I can get my jacket out. It's performs really well keeping me dry and warm in the worst of the Scottish Highland weather.
I've not had a  problem with the zip, as reported in other reviews. I use a little zip oil each year when it comes out of hibernation. I'm  disappointed when the weather turns warmer as I need to put my jacket away until next winter.
review.name: Best winter jacket ever.

review.reviewBody:
Keeps you warm well below 0 F with appropriate layers. 

Good quality material. 

Zipper is the weakest part of the jacket, a total nuisance, you have to fuss with it without gloves on and with gloves it becomes nearly impossible. Absolutely terrible design. The only reason I rate 3 and not 4 stars.
review.name: With layers, keeps you warm

review.reviewBody: Had many 'winter' jackets previously. This is by far the best. Loads of pockets and is really practical. Looks cool too!
review.name: Best of my 'winter" jackets'.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Fjällräven Nuuk Parka last year after extensive research on parkas. There are many excellent options available from top Canadian brands, including several popular domestic ones. What set the Nuuk apart from its competitors is the combination of wind resistance, waterproofing, and durability. Waterproofing is a key factor, especially in heavy, wet snow like we’re experiencing today. I never have to worry about the coat getting soaked through while hanging after coming in from snow or rain. I have found the jacket to be good down to ~ -20 Celsius, but everyone’s comfort level is different.

Another standout feature of the Fjällräven Nuuk is the attention to detail, particularly in the pocket placement. The jacket has an abundance of pockets, making it easy to keep essentials like my phone, keys, gloves, and toque readily accessible, unlike other brands where you have to fish through deep stash pockets.

Lastly, the build quality is exceptional—essentially bulletproof—and backed by Fjällräven. I expect the jacket to outlast me and be something I can pass down to my kids. As for the front zipper, while it took a bit of getting used to (especially if you’re accustomed to North American designs), I’ve had little trouble with it. The zipper is high quality and will last a long time, unlike some I’ve experienced on products from brands like TNF.
review.name: Solid Choice for Harsh Canadian Winters

review.reviewBody:
I have now been through one full year with my Nuuk parka. It is truly amazing. Extremely high quality, truly waterproof, yet not too heavy. Extremely warm. I sometimes forego gloves and just use the parka's lined hand pockets. The hood is very adjustable with the wire frame. Very well-designed pockets, and lots of them external and internal. I sometimes forget which pocket I used for something.

So, the zipper. I have gotten used to it but getting the zipper inserted and started can be a challenge, especially in low light. I do wish it was easier. Nonetheless, this parka is about as close to perfect as I have ever seen. Very highly recommended.

I am considering also getting the Nuuk Lite for its similar build quality and features, to use when it is the temperatures are too high to use the Nuuk.
review.name: A superb parka for cold, wet weather

review.reviewBody: Timeless design. Rain, cold, city or trekking, excellent in all circunstances
review.name: Design and functionality

review.reviewBody: The material is now recycled which is totally different to the previous non recycled version. Recycled Nuuk feels cheap and I'm not impressed with it. Crinkled look which looks shabby. Wish I bought the non recycled Nuuk now! Wonder where they get these recycled Polymide materials from as it isn't from Fjällräven materials. And they charge the same price! Scandalous!
review.name: Massive Difference Recycled Nuuk...for the worst!

review.reviewBody:
Bought this just before Christmas 2023.
 Main use for winter trips to the Baltics , 
Norwegian cruise later in the year
 and closer to home winter dog walks in the UK .

First used in anger during a couple of days of snow and minus 2 dog walks in UK  amd then cold wet rainy long weekend in Riga.
No complaints whatsoever other than I was too warm at the airport! 

Pockets are plentiful , no issues with zip as others mention and quick drying .

Wore just a normal cotton T Shirt underneath with temps down to -5, I'm a warm person anyway and was on occasions too warm
review.name: Warm and Dry

name: Nuuk Parka - Men's
