review.reviewBody: I bought these about two months ago and am already experiencing damage. They are comfortable and cute, but the quality is not there.
comment: Hello Sam, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: I love all sorrel products. I'm always a size 8.5 in all their shoes, I should have tried them on before throwing out the box, but they are a little to tight.
review.name: Size up
comment: Hello StaceyV, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ Rush Ripstop Sneaker is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: These are incredible! Sorel has really jumped forward in competing with the rest of the shoe market. I wish they had more colors but I’ll definitely be buying extras of these as backups! They are made of slick water resistant material but somehow still so breathable. They are so hardy and comfortable. I got a few other great sorel shoes this purchase but this pair is by far my favorite. Their shoes seem to run wide which I love because all of my other brands seems to be running more and more narrow lately. So they are a great choice for wider feet.
review.name: New favorite shoe ! My new go to.

review.reviewBody: I typically wear a women’s 9 in athletic shoes. The size 9 seemed a little tight so I ordered the 9 1/2. The 9 1/2 are a little roomy but I adore the style so I decided to keep the 9 1/2. The shoes are comfortable and look great with various clothe options. This shoe has become my go to travel shoe. Great airport option.
review.name: My go to travel shoe

review.reviewBody: I got these in another color and couldn’t wait for the grey ones. Super comfortable and nice quality… totally recommended
review.name: LOVE THESE!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, walking on clouds! No breaking in, super light and they also look good!
review.name: Great sneakers

review.reviewBody: I bought these last year and the support is so terrible it hurts my back to wear them in the first place
review.name: Bad support
comment: Hello Em, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry our Women's Kinetic™ Rush Ripstop Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: The rubber front flap pice immediately started peeling off of both shoes with minor wear
comment: Hello, Ashley, We’re sorry the front broke. Please contact our support at (888) My-Sorel or web chat so we can make this right.

review.reviewBody: This shoe runs terribly small. I’m a solid 8m and even the 8 1/2 is too small. I’ll need a 9 but I’m thinking it’ll look so long. Unsure about keeping.
review.name: Terrible Sizing
comment: Hello Pebbles, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ Rush Ripstop Sneaker is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: My feet don’t hurt during the day but I’ve had these shoes for 2 months now and the are already tearing apart on the sole and I do not wear them everyday.
review.name: Spend your money on something else
comment: Hello, Juju91, We’re sorry the sole broke. Please contact our support at (888) My-Sorel or web chat so we can make this right.

review.reviewBody: Bought a newer SUV. Rear seats are flat, and everything I throw back there tumbles around because I drive with purpose. Bought this, and have it sit just behind driver seat. PERFECT! NOTHING tumbles. It is made really well, and of course, looks cool !! Several people have commented that they didn't know The North Face made 'such a thing'... Love it!
review.name: One of the coolest things I have purchased from TNF !!!

review.reviewBody: Tremendous storage Goes flat and pops up. Perfect companion for my Jeep.
review.name: Just add to Jeep and perfect storage

review.reviewBody: It feels very sturdy, It's spacious and has two mesh compartments in the inside and one in the outside. I use it for different things like carrying tools, camera gear, groceries, and beach gear. It's great for roadtrips, not so great for air travel as it is not as light (but that is due to its sturdiness). I opted for this size instead of the M or L because it fits my day to day better. The things I would like to see be implemented might be a removal top cover. And a padded shoulder strap. The shoulder strap is it's biggest drawback if you are carrying heavy items or carrying it for a while. You can easily replace the strap with a padded one so it's not the end of the world but it would be nice to have it from the get go.
review.name: Greatly Built for Day to Day life and adventures

review.reviewBody: I bought 7 of these and use them to organize and carry camping gear in my Travel trailer.
review.name: Perfect for organizing and carrying camping gear

review.reviewBody:
Bought a Kanken Sling, and I love the bag. The wear/patina starts showing soon but I love the weared look of the patina in these bags. 
The reason I give 4 starts instead of 5 is because the back of the Kanken Sling has the webbings (W shaped) of the same material as the hold, and those webbings cause pilling on clothes (specially the more sensitive materials).
review.name: I love this bag, but..

review.reviewBody: After a month of use the bag looks 10yrs old. Faded and color worn off around all the edges. Fjallraven does not offer warranty for quality of the material . I would not recommend buying unless you want the old worn look

This little but mighty backpack will be perfect for when I am abroad, which is twice a year for a month each time, because it is not heavy or too big for my frame. When I’m out and about sightseeing or hiking, I only need a few items, not a great big, heavy leather backpack. I will also use it as my every-day-carry as my handbag/purse. And the colors available are gorgeous.  It is so well-made!
review.name: Perfect for traveling light!

review.reviewBody: I love this bag! Material seems to be good quality but It does get dirty, but I do not mind. I got the gray/fog color. I would love to get more colors. Perfect size and strap is comfortable around shoulder.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: i usually hate splurging on bags because they never tend to last, but i’ve had my sling in clay for about two years now- i’m a super accident prone person, and i needed a bag that could deal with getting thrown around or beat up. it’s been handling that very well! there’s some minor discoloration/scratches on the bag, but all issues are solely cosmetic and would probably come out with a gentle wash :) carries a good deal of stuff (calculator, phone, glasses, etcetera) and i get tons of compliments on it. definitely worth buying if you’re a mess like me haha
review.name: perfect for bag breakers!

review.reviewBody: fit two chipotle burritos with a side of queso in this bag. could go to war and this bag would still be in good condition.
review.name: live by this bag

review.reviewBody: cute but too many straps… should be a little tote or a little sling but not both
review.name: cute but not practical

review.reviewBody: It has been over a year that i have my pink one and i still love it! she went with me on my hiking trip, theme park visits, as well as multiple beach trips. I just bought the black no.2 sling and loved it even more due to it being softer and no sharp edges.
review.name: i love it

review.reviewBody: It’s so cute, especially the two color styles. I hope more come out that look like the mini or are completely unique.
review.name: More Colorful Styles Please!

review.reviewBody: This bag is the PERFECT size. I’m not a purse person, I prefer large pockets or waist bags, but this bag holds so much without being too heavy and it is a cute miniature of my standard Kanken backpack. The arctic green is my fave color!!
review.name: Perfect bag for people who aren’t purse people.

name: Kanken Sling

review.reviewBody: The perfect amount of cushion and so comfortable, I don't want to take them off.   I don't like too much cushion it hurts my knees.  This running shoe is responsive, lightweight, supportive and sooo comfortable to just wear around on vacation and getting a lot of steps in.  I ordered a 1/2 size bigger then I normally buy and thought it was perfect and roomy.   The blue color is so pretty too I didn't want to get them dirty!
review.name: Most comfortable shoe on the planet!!

review.reviewBody: I have been an Altra Lone Peak hiker for years, and use La Sportiva for approach shoes but can only wear the TX 3 and 4 due to how wide my foot it in the toe box. I don't like the baggy fit of Altras for some hikes, and was looking for something with more of a performance fit. The La Sportiva Prodigo is the shoe I was looking for. It fits great, with plenty of room in the forefoot, but has a good design and lacing and fits well through the rest of the shoe.
review.name: Wide toe-box, performance fit

review.reviewBody: I just received these shoes and decided to test them on a 10 mile run this morning. I love them! Super comfortable and supportive but minimalist enough to have good stability on rocky/loose terrain. I’ll have to test them next on a trail with more elevation gain/loss to see how traction is and support down hill but so far I’m really happy. I’ve never been a “runner” so I don’t know anything about stride, strike or all that jazz. When I do run I want something lightweight but supportive and these are doing it for me! Sometimes shoes that are more on the minimalist side make my calves/Achilles hurt. I had no issues with that today.
review.name: Just received and tested with 10 miles

review.reviewBody:
I love the Prodigios!  Was a big fan of the Helio 3 and the Akasha and saw this prototype when I was in Europe last year - the rep described it as kind of a combination of the two shoes. Really liked the flex and speedy feel of the Helios but thought they could use a little little more cushioning, and also loved the Akashas but thought they could use a little more flex. 
The prodigios have a good amount of flex and feel super lightweight, but they also feel more cushioned and responsive, like a good daily trainer for fast or easy efforts on trails. Super happy with them! My only complaint is that for me the size wasn't consistent with my other la Sportivas - I ended up getting two pairs a half size apart and they each fit but one I'll definitely use for longer days when my feet might swell and the other definitely for shorter runs because the fit is more ideal from the start. Not necessarily a la Sportiva problem as I am probably slightly between sizes.
review.name: Fast, responsive shoes!

name: Prodigio Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This could easily have been a 5-star review, except for one major drawback; a non-removable insole. On the pro side of things, I loved the out-of-the-box fit and comfort of this shoe (I have a standard B or medium width foot, size 9) and I loved the look and the versatility that it provided as I bought it for a trip to Japan where I'd be both exploring the urban areas (and wanted to have a couple cute outfits) as well as doing some treks (in the rain). This shoe was unbelievably comfortable for the many, many miles I walked around the cities of Japan and for the light day hikes I did but when it came time for serious treks in wet conditions, I seriously regret that I was willing to overlook the insole issue. I would normally never buy a hiking shoe without a removable insole for either upgrading to a Currex or a Smartfeet insole and/or for the need to pull the insole after a big hike to let it dry. Unfortunately, I spent my longest trek on the trip (six days) in soggy feet; both from too much sweating in a waterproof hiker in warm, high-humidity and from days and days of rain. If you're just a light, day hiker, this shoe could be perfect.
review.name: Almost love.

review.reviewBody: I have an average width foot and ordered 1/2 size up.  This was my 2nd pair of ON shoes, other for running.  For some reason these shoes hug my feet not in a comfortable way.  Not tight but tight enough to feel the shoe which after about an hour makes my feet ache.  Hiking shoe not soft and not very cushioned.  Maybe they could be broken in but I’m used to very comfortable, supportive shoes right out of the box.  Could be ON shoes are just not for my foot shape.  Returned as not comfortable for me.
review.name: Did not feel like a cloud

review.reviewBody:
High: Love the shoe in terms of overall fit and comfort. The sole is very comfortable. 

Low: the top eyelet where the laces thread through has already town pretty significantly after 4 months of light use.

Cushioning at the heel was super comfortable on one shoes and notably overstuffed on the other. Not something you get used to; and it doesn’t settle in or form after use, so it shown to be an ongoing issue, despite my wishes lol
review.name: Confused about quality

review.reviewBody: I purchased these to try on as there weren’t any in store. They were comfortable with good stability. I have in between narrow to regular foot width and they fit like a glove. The reason I gave them four stars is the sides came up just high enough to rub on my ankle bone-I have a torn up ankle that protrudes medially and will lose skin if it rubs. I stuck with same brand low top waterproof trail runner instead. I typically wear an 8.5-9 in running shoes and this fit in a 9.
review.name: Great for narrow to medium width foot

name: Cloudwander Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this pillow to upgrade from an older model from another brand that was super narrow and just not soft enough to use on its own. Needless to say, all of my previous complaints about sleeping outdoors were addressed with this purchase! The pillow cover might be my favorite part of the fillo as it is so luxuriously soft. The shape of the pillow when inflated is also nice- it sort of keeps your head from slipping off the side as it tapers ever so slightly. My only complaint might be the height, but that's on me for not knowing my needs (height is included in the specs)  I also have Nemo sleeping gear and tuck my puffer into the pillow pocket to add height and problem solved!
review.name: Light and Wide enough to move around!

review.reviewBody:
NEMO sent me this pillow some time ago. Unfortunately It’s been a bit over a year since I had the opportunity to get out and really test it. It was worth the wait (and the weight). 
It’s exceptionally light (barely worth weighing), but still very comfortable. The washable soft cover is a nice touch. No, plasticy or rubbery bladder against your skin. 
It doesn’t inflate quite as high as I would like as a side sleeper, but I believe there is another version that offers a bit more loft at the price of a bit more weight.
It packs up super small. So small in fact that I regularly have a hard time finding it on my shelves when I’m packing for a trip 😂.
It fits very nicely into the pillow pocket on the NEMO sleeping bag (No surprise there). That said, I never do that as I prefer the freedom to put an arm under the pillow sometimes. 
I’m also able to use my flextail pump to inflate it so no moisture gets in. 
I recently took it backpacking on a trip in the cotswolds, UK and had a pretty good night’s sleep using it. It isn’t anywhere near as comfortable as my standard NEMO Fillow because it lacks the memory foam topper, but if you’re looking for an ultralight pillow this is the one for you.
review.name: Exceptionally light backpacking pillow.

review.reviewBody: I have had this pillow for several years and I have tried nearly everything to make it work. It is light yes. That's the only bonus. I love Nemo products and rave about their tensor pad but this pillow has just failed in so many ways. The valve pops out easily, the pillow is too small and it slides around all over the place while you sleep. I needs some silicone strips to stop it from slipping and a divot in the center to keep your head in place; otherwise if you tilt your head at all while you sleep, you're going to wake up. Sadly after all this trial and error, I will have to buy a different pillow.
review.name: Meh
comment: Thanks for the feedback! We do offer the Fillo in an array of sizes and weights but I'm sorry to hear about the valve popping out! The valve does have a locked position. We'll reach out directly to see if we can be of assistance. Thanks again for the review!

review.reviewBody:
7/10/23
Finally, after another crummy neck episode, sleeping poorly on ground, asked around and was recommended this pillow. Bought one. Really. nifty and worth price and pack space. am female, 5'6"back and side sleeper. Can blow up and adjust firmness: yet, packs down well. Good sleep is a non-negotiable. Having a  good dedicated travel pillow not a frill, but a necessary item for you to repair your battered body. I will never again sleep with a wadded up piece of clothing for a pillow. This is way cheaper and so less painful than an ortho surgeon or PT when your neck or spine are messed up.  Been there.  Consider one.
review.name: Worth Pack Space

review.reviewBody: Very lightweigh, comfortable, compresses down to very little . .the valve is 'funky' - not so easy to use and difficult to operate with cold or wet hands - it does not operate smoothly though it does hold pressure, once you get it open and get it closed.
review.name: More than a decent backpacking pillow

review.reviewBody: I needed a new pillow since vowing to make the backpacking experience more comfortable for me and heard great things about this pillow. It is super light and packs very small. Everyone is so impressed with how pillowy this backpacking pillow feels. I do wish that it had more height but it will work great in the backcountry.
review.name: Obsessed!

review.reviewBody: I have used this pillow on a few trips and always times been happy with it.  It packs very small, and inflates to be a good usable size, I wouldn't want it any smaller, but it still fits in the top of my mummy bag.  Its quite comfortable and easy to inflate.  My main issue with it is the valve.  I had it pop out a couple times, however never when I was sleeping, only when I leaned on it with one hand or an elbow, however its so quick to reflate its barely an issue.  I wish the valve was the same as on their sleeping pads, allowing for inflation with the pump sack, and the slow release valve, however this is mostly wistful thinking.  For what it has and is its great.
review.name: Great little backpacking pillow

review.reviewBody:
Its a shame i cant use this pillow.  Its proportions (but not the overall size) are very similar to a bed pillow but for me three big issues.  1.  The valve is very difficult to use.  Simply following the instructions on the valve itself doesn't make it easier.  This applies to both opening and closing.  In a nutshell, the valve gets stuck in multiple places making it very difficult to inflate properly.  Also, in this age flat valves should be standard.  They seem to work much better.

2. Why have the most slippery material underneath?  Even with elastic stays it still moves too easily while sleeping.  

3.  This pillow is just a tad small to be comfortable all night.  I would increase the proportions a little and allow it to be a bit heavier.  Anything up to 180 grams would be fine if the comfort was there.  The regular fillo just too heavy at 260grams +.

Considering all the above the pillow is waaaaaaaay too expensive.
review.name: Great proportions but poor valve and slippery
comment: Hello, sorry that the Fillo Elite didn't work for you! We've found that setting the valve in either the open position or the closed position before tuning the valve can be helpful. In terms of size, I'd recommend checking out the Fillo Elite Luxury which is longer and weighs in at only 112 grams. If you have questions, please contact our CS team at Journey@NEMOEquipment.com

review.reviewBody: Quick to inflate, light, good shape and form for head to rest naturally on. I like the jersey fabric like material used. Compresses nicely to fit in pack.
review.name: Well rounded pillow

review.reviewBody: Sweet little pillow packs small and does well though a bit more loft could help. Still, anything to help your sleep game.
review.name: Good ultralight pillow.

name: Fillo Elite Pillow

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and light weight. I do not get too hot in it.
review.name: Sun Shirt

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and breathe as well. I’ve bought five of these so far and they’re fantastic. One thing that some people might care about is that the paint or coating on the snaps comes off and chips really easily. I don’t really care about this so it’s not an issue for me, but some people that are concerned with fashion might have an issue with it.
review.name: Super comfortable, the snaps are not durable

review.reviewBody: Wear them everyday. Going to the store or climbing in Gunx. Light, stretchy, neat looking and dry fast. They do come out of wash wrinkled but two minutes in the dryer on low with a damp towel fixes that easily. I always line dry my synthetic stuff btw
review.name: GOAT mountain shirt

review.reviewBody: Didn't think I would like this shirt after returning one in another color last year, but this one is so much better! Comfortable and sized right. Washes well. Nice enough to wear to work or out on the town.
review.name: I would buy this shirt again!

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, secure snap buttons, and fits great.
review.name: Favorite shirt in a long time

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shirts I've ever worn in all weather. Be cautious when washing as they will pill or snag if not carefully washed. I own nearly 10 of these in long and short sleeve and they are the best travel and work wear I have.
review.name: My favorite all time shirts

review.reviewBody: Just the way I like it! Cool, breathable, light weight and stretch. Will buy again.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable, lightweight shirt with an excellent fit (5'9" athletic build and medium fits great) and makes for easy packing. They do come out of the washer/dryer pretty wrinkled with some wrinkles falling out when hung, but not enough to make a big difference- the reason for the 4 stars.
review.name: Comfortable, fits well, but does wrinkle

review.reviewBody: This has become my go to every day shirt! Lightweight, comfortable, stretchy, fast drying. My only desire would be to improve its durability.
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite casual and outdoor shirts. I own several of these in most of the colors. The fabric is light and silky and with just the right stretch. They are nice and breathable for hiking but can also be worn around town or at work. The naval blue and and darker red (from circa 2021?) are my favorites and both look very sharp when paired with white pants. The current orange-red one (redrock) is not as pleasant of a color as the previous darker red. Please bring back the darker red from a few years ago! Also consider making them in more interesting/bolder colors.
review.name: Favorite shirt

name: Astroman Short-Sleeve Sun Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Been rocking these on the gravel bike for a few months now, and I've been impressed. My favorite offroad shoe is the Vento Ferox, which has a 10/10 sole stiffness, is super light, low volume and narrow, and has a velcro closure around the cuff and a lower BOA dial for the forefoot. The Proxy, on the other hand, has an 8/10 sole stiffness, is a tiny bit heavier, has a roomier fit throughout, with a single BOA dial at the top.

I love a stiff shoe to prevent hotspots and for just general power transfer, and the Proxy is still stiff, but objectively more comfortable than the Ferox. No hotspots, higher volume that accommodates how my feet swell a tiny bit on longer rides, and easier adjustment on the fly with the single BOA dial.

One design decision that Fizik makes on all their shoes is how long they make the cleat nut channels. I need a very rearward cleat position due to some ankle instability (along with less saddle setback and longer stems!), and every Fizik shoe allows me to do this. Plenty long enough fore as well for folks who have a more typical cleat placement.

No questions on durability and breathability. Fizik has their materials dialed.

Trust the size chart. I wear a 11/11.5 US Men's, 45 Fizik, 45.5 Shimano, 45.5 Giro, 46 Lake.

Feel free to call/chat in and ask for me if you have questions!

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: EXCELLENT Balanced Gravel/XC Shoe

name: Vento - Proxy X3 Shoe

review.reviewBody: I intentionally bought tri shoes for summer rides but not triathlons (haven't done triathlons for a while, so can't review now from race/transition perspective), I just wanted to have comfy, breathable, and simple shoes but with good supportive fit. It fully met my expectations, also was attracted by both velcros outward - no crankset rubs, no cuts. Front velcro seems to be a little bit long and you can't cut it, but I have narrow feet and as mentioned it's outward, so doesn't bother me at all.   Sizing: I got 43, fits the same as my old Shimano in 43, also have Sidi in 43.5 which are slightly more roomy, and my daily nike shoes are US 9.5, so sizing seems pretty standard for cycling shoes. Overall, it's well-made shoes with very stiff outsole, soft and comfy upper with good feet support.
review.name: Comfortable and good fit

review.reviewBody:
They've proven very comfortable as lightweight dungarees. What has been most notable is that the green seems quite good at shedding muck or not showing it. I'll need to wash them after a very muddy day yesterday but I think this will be their first wash.

Fit is very good, even as a man though the fit I have chosen is more correct for my hip size than waist. The lesser taper in the larger size at least may allow that to work. I am 35 waist, near enough 40 hips at the moment. wearing size L on the size chart (33 waist, 43 hip).
review.name: Very comfortable light dungarees

review.reviewBody: So happy to get these! I purchased the green size medium. I am 5’3” and 130 lbs. and I normally wear a 40 in fjallraven pants. I am very happy with the fit. Nice and comfy. A little loose but that is my idea of how bibs should fit. So happy they produced these. I plan on getting a second pair as so as I can afford them. Thank you!
review.name: Perfect bibs

review.reviewBody: I love these coats! The color, the design, how warm they are, literally everything about them. I found one on clearance last summer and fell in love with it! I just knew I had to get another. I waited til I saw a sale and snagged this one. Just as good as the first one!
review.name: Love the first one I have, had to buy another!

review.reviewBody: I love the colors and the fit, I got a 2xl and it’s roomy, I probably could have gone with xl
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I received the jacket quickly and it is so pretty. The colors are beautiful and it’s very warm. Super lightweight. I would definitely buy this again or more products from this company.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly! I’m 5’4”, 120# and got the XS after reading some reviews the sleeves were long. I usually wear small. They are just right. I appreciate how light this jacket is for the warmth. I love the colors and get lots of compliments. I’m happy with Cotopaxi for practicing sustainability too.
review.name: Capa Insulated Hooded Jacket

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof, but very light weight, comfortable, and warm.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket. It is exactly what I was looking for. I work in the city, so the thing I love is how packable it is. This jacket is also warm. I was outside today, it was in the 30’s and raining, all I had was a t-shirt underneath and I was nice and cozy. I also love how the hood fits around your face. It doesn’t easily blow off or allow rain/cold air to come through. The colors are fantastic too. I would highly recommend this jacket to anyone.
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: Great fitting coat. Love the colors. Very light and packable. I am 5'9, 165 lbs with a long torso.
review.name: Great fitting coat. Love the

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this jacket almost every day for the past week. I wore it hiking, walking, anytime it was below 50 and just casual wear. Fits perfects and is really nice and lightweight. I am 5’10 and normally struggle to find tops that fit my arm length but this is perfect.
review.name: My favorite lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I have purchased other Cotopaxi products but this is my first jacket. I am impressed! The quality and workmanship of this jacket, as well as the fit, is far better than jackets I have purchased from two other major brands. My first thought after trying this on was that I wanted another in a different color. This is perfect for spring, fall and early northern Minnesota winters. My only suggestion to make this even better would be to add a zippered inside pocket.
review.name: My new favorite!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but warm. Great for the coast and camping.
review.name: Great Jacket

comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My spouse has a pair of these so I thought I'd try them. I was disappointed . I wear HOKA Bondis and Stinsons in size 13. The Anacapa 13s felt like 13.5 to 14 size. As soon as I put them on I realized that I would wear thru the top of the toe in a very short time. I also kept tripping on the extended heels. I returned the shoes.
review.name: I won't be buying these

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got the Hoka Anacapa Breeze Low shoes for hiking and love them -- they are the best hiking shoes I've owned. They have a fantastic sole that is very grippy -- on gravel, rocks, damp grass and mud. On inclines, they do not slip at all, which gives me a lot of confidence with my ascents and descents. The shoes themselves are very comfortable and well-cushioned -- I can readily do 6-8 hour hikes in them without chafing or discomfort. They are quite breathable, but one should note that that they are NOT waterproof, so one needs to be careful not to step in puddles of water or they will get wet (there is a GTX version if one will be stepping in water). My only negative is that the shoes are slightly snug for me, so one should try both the regular and wide versions and then make the choice.
review.name: Amazing shoes for hiking

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have done some long hikes with them. I added a carbon fiber insert which I think is an improvement for uneven ground
review.name: Very good

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Maybe it's the style... but not as comfortable as my other Hoka's
review.name: Not like my other Hoka's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: As an avid hiker, I have purchased multiple pairs of Speedgoats both regular and mid-goretex for the trail. I bought a pair of the Anacapa Breeze as everyday summer shoes, dog-walking, etc. I was very disappointed with the fit. I find that the banding that gives the shoe form is restrictive and provides unnecessary pressure points on the side of my feet which becomes uncomfortable after short periods of wearing. Will stick to the Speedgoats going forward. The shoe is made well and has Hoka durability, nfotunately it just does not fit the same as their other shoes fit me.
review.name: Not as comfortable as previous Speedgoats I have purchased

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have and loved seven pairs of hooks. purchased another pair, left shoe squeaked with every step. exchanged for another pair, same thing, left shoe squeaked. tried to exchange for a different style, never received third pair, got a refund instead. guess they don't want my business!
review.name: quality slipping

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the colors. The materials are high quality, these should last a while. I wear these everyday for work and hiking especially. I have the recovery sliders I like kicking around in at home and around the pool and stuff. Honestly these are my favorite shoes from Hoka yet.
review.name: Best hiking shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: very sensitive feet shoes are to soft for me customer Service its excellent
review.name: love the shoes

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Started my Hoka experience with Clifton 9s, which are about the most comfortable athletic shoe I've ever worn (and I have worn many over several decades). However, the Clifton soles wore through pretty quickly so I purchased the Anacapa hiking shoes for durability AND comfort. While not as cushy as the Cliftons, the Anacapas are quite comfortable and offer the vaunted Vibram soles for expected durability. Great combination so far. May take these to Africa in the autumn.
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these for an upcoming trip to Durango, CO this summer. Fits Perfect and so comfy!
review.name: Fits perfect!

name: Anacapa Breeze Low Hiking Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Chariot Sleek Sibling Seat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Sleek Sibling Seat online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Overall this seat is the same quality construction and has the same features as the main seat. After graduating from the bassinet attachment, my baby loves this and I love that he sleeps well in it. It fully reclines just like the main seat to give a lay-flat sleeping experience for my now 8 month old who is too big for the bassinet. 

Be aware it does have a lower weight limit so the main seat has to be for the heavier child. 

I also wish the main seat and sibling seat were interchangeable so bigger kid could sit in either the higher or lower position on the stroller. Sometimes it would make sense for my bigger child to be lower to the ground so they could climb in/out of the stroller more independently. The sibling seat will not clip into the main seat position.
review.name: Works decently well

name: Chariot Sleek Sibling Seat

review.reviewBody:
Great product. I've used to transport 2 adult bikes on about 8 long distance trips (NY to New England) over the past year.
No major issues. Product is sturdy. Bikes are safe.
It does take about 20 mins to fit on car and load bikes . Make sure to disable rear camera drive assist, and auto tailgate close. Also slightly blocks rear camera but this is ok
review.name: Outway 3 works

review.reviewBody:
Purchased back in 2021 for my VW Jetta and works perfectly. Only 4 stars due to similar issues to prior reviews, namely the instructions can be unclear. However, once you watch the YouTube video for set up you should be fine going forward! I find I need an extra set of hands to hold the trunk in place when initially placing the carrier onto the vehicle, but afterwards I can complete it alone in about 5 minutes. 

My car does not have an extreme spoiler, so I haven't had that issue like others did below.

Quality is excellent on mine, I expect it to last many years.
review.name: Good for cars without a spoiler.

review.reviewBody: Multiple people have tried to get our two mountain bikes onto this rack. There’s no possible way to fit them together. Super frustrating.
review.name: Only fits one bike

review.reviewBody: Just bought my wife a bike, and in addition to mine we found orselves in need of a 2 bike rack.  This item came up a lot in the third party review sites that I frequent so I pulled the trigger.  I was not disappointed.  Although pricey, the quality of make and overall feel does not make you feel bad about the purchase.  The only negatives I can write (which are not really that bad) are that installation was a pain, you absolutely must read directions carefully, and it slightly obstructs the rear view cam - but I would imagine all bike racks of this style would have this issue.
review.name: Solid Rack

review.reviewBody:
Bottom line is quality build easy to set up
Fits my Subaru Outback and Honda civic 
I would recommend this product to anyone
review.name: Bottom line

review.reviewBody: Returned the bike rack as the arm latches were stuck in the open position so bike could not be placed on bike rack.
review.name: Arm latches didn’t work

review.reviewBody: I was not advised of this and only instructions are  by silent video.   Very dissatisfied
review.name: Assembly required
comment:
Thank you for sharing your input on the Thule OutWay bike rack. 
I'm sorry you were not satisfied with the assembly and installation instructions for this bike rack. Most Thule products, and other bike racks from other brands, ship with some assembly required due to shipping size constraints and to prevent possible shipping damage. Assembly instructions are shown on the product page and user manual, available for download on the same page. 
Thule user manuals and installation videos are produced in our Sweden headquarters. Because they are designed for use by our global customers, they use few words to be usable regardless of langauge. If you would like live assistance and more vehicle-specific fit advice, you can contact Thule Customer Service at 800-238-2388 Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:30pm Eastern Standard Time.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Outway 2 for my Volvo XC70 a couple of weeks ago.  The assembly video on YouTube was a very useful guide.  The Outway 2 is a very solid, well engineered bike rack.  On a side note, I lost the keys on my first outing, fortunately after I had removed my bikes, and Thule replaced the keys quickly.  So don't forget to record the key number and to leave one key in your vehicle's glove box.  Bravo Thule!
review.name: Clever design

review.reviewBody: The rack itself is good, strong and secure for my Honda Civic but the bumper straps that hold the bikes together and to the car failed miserably and broke in multiple places over a few days. To be clear, the bikes were still secure on the frame - the frame was good. But the bumper that hold the bikes together broke in 6 different places over a few days. Seems the rubber could not handle the sun. Would not recommend this rack unfortunately until that is fixed.
review.name: Good frame, bad parts
comment:
Hello Sean, 
I'm sorry to hear about the damage to the support anti-sway. This could be caused by numerous different factors, including mounting position, environmental effects, or possibly a defect in the material. This is something Thule would generally cover under the limited lifetime warranty. 
It looks like one of our warranty team has already been in touch about replacing the damaged piece. Thank you for reaching out so we can help you get back to riding!

review.reviewBody: I bought a new car in May at the start of the Summer here in North America and needed a new Bicycle Rack that was compatible with the Car-Make-Model. This rack was perfect. I used it for three months without an issue. Then one day I needed to use the Locking Feature of the rack as I was going into a store after a ride. The Right Hand Lock will not  Unlock making the Rack unusable. This Rack would have been a Five Star but.....
review.name: It Was a Great Rack Until...

name: OutWay Hanging Bike Mount - 2 Bike
